comment: There wasnt much to love about this professor at all. In fact, a majority of my particular class dropped out before the semester was up. Her lectures were ineffective, her grading was sub par and nit-picky, and she proceeded to accuse most who did well on the final of cheating. Avoid this professor at all costs (if she is even going to continue).
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Lots of homework

comment: Absolutely the worst professor I have ever had she had an issue with one of my problems on the final and reported me for cheating when I did not even cheat. Very mean person and a horrible teacher with lots of dumb work. Also was not at all sympathetic towards students during pandemic
rating_tags: Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Bcs of the corona virus she switched to online testing and did an awful job. I couldn't figure out how to do a problem so she decided that i cheated on it, even tho i got the question wrong. Then she emailed me and SCAI about it bcs "academic integrity" and took 25 points off of my original test. I got a 60 on it, instead of an 85
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: Difficult to not pass this class. Mastery makeup is allowed. You will do a large amount of HW for a grade. What you make is what you make. Meaning, if you have a 79.9999% average, you'll "C" your way through.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: Prof. Hadaway allows you to retake quizzes and the midterm as many times as you need allowing you to get full credit back, as long as you do corrections and talk with her about it. This alone makes the class very possible to pass. As long as you pay attention in class, do homework, and talk to her about anything you need help with, you'll pass.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Great teacher, hard class. Gives a chance to make up every test for full credit. Lots of participation grades. Very available outside of class, and always happy to explain things. I would definitely take her for future math classes as the class is veryyy helpful for understanding. Will not change your grade at the end though, use extra credit early
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She taught me Calculus and never gave up on me and led me to be the computer scientist I am today.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Lots of homework

comment: She is a nice person but as a teacher, she is not. She gives over 3 hours of homework a day and when u have a problem set that adds 2 more hours. He quizzes are nothing like the homework. I went in for help all the time and still managed to fail.

As a person, Mrs. Hadaway is very kind and sweet. But as an instructor, she is not good. She over assigns classwork and has a very strict grading method and assessment for re-quizzing. During the class I continually went to SI sessions, came in earlier to get help, and re-took every quiz and still failed.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCE. Horrible, HORRIBLE, grading system. 8 quizzes, midterm and final, textbook project and leadership project. The last four are averaged together, but the 8 quizzes remain individual: out of those 9 grades, whatever your lowest grade is, is your grade in the class. Quizzes and tests are SUPER hard.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I do not recommend this professor. She assigns an amount of work that is impossible to maintain in addition to whatever other classes you are taking, and her grading system is terrible. She tells you at the beginning of the semester that the lowest grade that you make on an assignment is your final class grade and she isn't lying. Do not take.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Though Dr. Hadaway seems like a very nice person, her grading system is HORRIBLE. the lowest grade you make on ANYTHING (test, quiz, homework) is your grade in the class. no matter if you have all A's and one zero. She also isn't lenient with grading. If your answer is right and the work is wrong, whole thing is wrong. Good luck I do not recommend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: DO NOT take this class!! her grading system is absolutely TERRIBLE. Basically the lowest grade you have on a quiz is your grade in the class. She gives you retakes but makes them a thousand times harder. you will be trying to learn the new material but can't because of everything you have to do to retake. AVOID taking her class at all costs!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: DO NOT take her class even if it is your last resort. There is an excess of busy work, her grading system is ridiculous and her office hours are not beneficial. She moves too fast and honestly doesnt offer much assistance. I've talked to her twice about how concerned I am about my grade and she still offered no help. AVOID!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Just avoid her at all costs, even if she is the last teacher available. Her class was the only class avaialable for me to take at the time i could register, i regret my choice in taking her class. If you end up in the same position i was in, just take it next semester with A DIFFERENT teacher. Ive been struggling this ENTIRE semester
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: RUN!!! Whatever you do, do NOT take this teacher. She has a nice personality, but she is an AWFUL teacher. She lets you retake any quiz and the midterm, but it doesnt help because she makes the retake questions much harder than the original. I was at the brink of failing upon the second week. She used to teach AP Calc, acts like she still does.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I had no choice but to drop the class because I was at risk of failing within the first month (I am an A/B student). There is too much homework, the quizzes are nothing like the notes or assignments, and she is a critical grader. Whatever your lowest grade is in the class is what your overall grade will be (fail one quiz fail the class).
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I took Dr. Hadaway and I should have withdrew because I got behind and regret taking her calculus at KSU; transferred back to Reinhardt in light of trying to pass the second time. Good luck, but don't take her for calculus unless you want to struggle!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: She is a good lady that gives many opportunities for extra credit, though it isn't always helpful. I feel behind really fast did all the work she wanted us to do. Even after that I couldn't understand any of the stuff.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I took Calculus with Ms. Hadaway and I got an F because she grades very intensely. She began using a new system of grading during my semester there, and you essentially receive a letter grade for each topic you will cover in the class. Out of all the topics, the lowest grade received on any one of them, if your overall grade for the class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: we did this thing Called documentation and it was honestly helpful because she counted the ones you got right for a total number you needed in a section. like if you got 3 integrals right on a test it went towards your goal of 20 integrals to make an A. There is A LOT of homework. If you have an A in all the sections but an F in one you get an F.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: As someone who needs this class and paid a lot of money for, Im angry. Do not take this class with her! Her new grading system is confusing and stressful. There is a lot of busy work that doesnt even count as a grade. She doesnt go by the point system or percentages, but by documentations. My grade in the class right now? I couldnt tell you
rating_tags: Tough Grader--SO MANY PAPERS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She is an extremely kind lady. Definitely makes you work for your grade, but it's not impossible. There are SO many opportunities for extra credit. If you put in the time and take advantage of the extra credit, you will pass. She's always available for extra help and makes sure you understand the material. I definitely recommend her!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Get ready to study hard for 4 credits difficult Calc1(itself). I took her Math1190 in Fall 2016. Her fast speaking could be a problem to ESL student. It was hard to manipulate knowledge from book to her assignments. Her office hours were a big help. A good base or review of all highschool math skills would help to get an A in this class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: It's only day 2 and I'm already lost in the class. I have to go home after every class and reteach myself because she goes so quickly I don't understand where we are. I almost walked out of class because I was so lost. She is sweet and I think she does care but she's just not a very good teacher. Theres also LOTS of homework so be prepared.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Although this teacher gives extra credit throughout the semester, you have to work really hard to get it. She does not relay the material in a way that is understandable to most students and I would not recommend taking this class from her.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: worst professor ever!!! she doesn't allow you to grasp the concept because you are rushed with another section before you take a quiz and test. I do not care how nice a professor is as long as they can teach. She gave too much homework from webassign to book problems to problem sets (which don't help at all)! good luck cause you'll need it to pass
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She is a nice person; however she is not a nice grader. Takes off points for the tiniest mistakes that eventually takes a toll on your grade. Teaches new material right before quizzes and rushes through the sections without elaboration. If you haven't taken calc or trig yet, try to get a different teacher.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She's a really nice lady .. it's just that she teaches really fast and it's really hard to catch up or if you're lost to get found again
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: she is too much I had to withdraw from her class do not take her I got so much stress because of the loading work even if you are good In math her class will no be easy
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: I do not like this lady. She thinks we have four hours everyday to give to just HER class. She talks way too fast during the lectures and doesn't explain the material well enough. Her tests, Problem Sets, Quizzes, Portfolios, Corrections, Now Work Problems are RIDICULOUS. BEWARE. She is an AP Teacher so she THINKS she knows how college works.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is a nice lady and she offers help in office hours. The main problem with her class is the work load (which is expected it is a math class) but the work load is hnestly beyond insane. You will have board work, problem sets, online hw and learning curves. If you have no prior knowledge of the subject avoid her for you own sanity.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Doesn't offer any explanation on the subject, only does a lot of practice problems in class that you won't see on the tests. Makes you do homework online and then turn in your work for it so you can get credit. Doesn't allow calculators, yet gives you problems with decimals.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS BY ANY MEANS.
Rushes through materials.  Offers extra credit but the work load is ridiculous.

I would NOT recommend for even my worst enemy to take this class. Hadaway, is a tough teacher. She expects you to put 3 hours between every class studying and she has these things called "problem sets". She grades  meticulously and her lectures does not correspond to homework or test. I've taken calc before in high school, and that didn't help.

Goes way to fast and teaches like you should know what's going on already.  Homework was totally different than what was being taught in class and makes you correct literally everything you do.  Will take points off for dumb things.

If I could have rated her a -10 I would. Literally the worst teacher I've ever had in my life. She was ridiculous in her meticulous grading and every lesson seemed to contradict the textbook and made it more confusing. I felt more confused and frustrated every time I left her class. From one very engaged student to the next DONT TAKE HER

If you have a lot of time on your hands this class will be easy  but if you have 5 classes you are screwed. Don't try to go for an A. If you pass you got an A in your heart. Keep Calm and Correct Your Mistakes. Good luck cause you need it.

WORST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD.  If you want your entire semester to be Horrible then take her.  Does not teach. She sits in her chair the entire class and has her students teach the class. She gives a lot of homework and gives you very little time to complete it.  This class will completely consume your life.  You will eat, sleep and breath cal.

If you have no experience in calculus it would be a good idea to avoid her. Pro: builds in a lot of extra credit and is willing to help you. Con: Office hours are too busy, takes of points for ridiculous things. She gives a lot of homework, but it's what I expected from a math class so I didn't think it was that bad. (Extra credit got me the A)

She's nice but do NOT take her class. She gives out tons of homework and most of it is pointless because you don't see the same type of problems on quizzes/tests. There's so much homework you won't have time to actually study for what you need to understand better and you can't learnt during office hours because she only has 30 minutes/week.

CLASS TAKEN: Calc I  LECTURES: Does not teach material. Does something called "board work" where students go do problems on the board all class long.   HOMEWORK: Lots of homework. 5 different things each week.   GRADING: Grades with grace  TESTS/QUIZES: Quiz every week. No study guides. Tests are hard. Makes you correct every work you get.

If you have not taken AP Calculus or something before this. Do not take her unless you are willing to learn nearly everything on your own. She goes in a super fast random order over the material and explains everything like you should already know it. A lot of busy work that has way more grade impact than it should. Grades things unreasonably.

I used to love math. I was so stressed trying to get everything done for this class I would seriously cry in frustration. She grades super hard and there is a ton of work and she doesn't teach. She has students do "board work". Student's that don't know what they're doing should't be basically teaching you. I had to drop this class.

Do not take her by any chance, even if you don't have a choice. Class is hard and ridiculous, goes through stuff quickly or you have to read it on your own. tests are hard and unclear and graded terrible. even if you like math you will hate it at her class. Drop the class if you have too, unless you are great at math.

She is a sweet lady, but not a very thorough teacher. She rushes things and goes too fast. Tests are hard and the homework is endless and complex to complete on the website because the website layout is confusing.

This is the most ridiculous class you will probably ever take. The home is ridiculous, the tests are insane and there is a pretty good chance that you could just simply fail. She takes a subject that is already hard enough and makes the class ridiculous

For those of you who took calculus in high school, then you might get a "pretty" satisfying grade. If you didn't, then stay away from her! She talks and explain everything so fast, even if you ask her for help she still won't slow down. Used to love math but it's driving me nuts now I learn more from youtube videos. Tests and home works are tough.

I took AP Calculus in high school and through out the lectures I would begin to remember what I had learned, until she continues to speak and completely confuses me. She is really bad at explaining. She also assigns copious amounts of homework. She claims you need to study 4 hours between classes but there is a lot more homework than that.

HORRIBLE. Rushes through material and expects you to understand. If you ask for  help, the best answer I received was that "This was a prerequisite to this class. You should already know this." And she did not help me. I  made an A in AP Calculus in high school and an A in precalculus last semester but received a 34 on my first test for Hadaway.

She rushes through everything and doesn't bother to wait up in class if you need help, you'll have to go to her office hours for that. She knows her stuff but if you have trouble understanding a concept you'll practically have to teach yourself. The only reason I'm doing well is bc I took AP Calc in high school. Find another teacher.

DONT TAKE HER! She teaches 1-2 topics a day; doesn't make sure we understand because she moves on regardless. Up to you to find extra help if needed (Math Lab, Office Hrs. Work on CalcPortal is ridiculously hard; and it does not correlate with how she wants her work done (yet we still have to do it.) Tests are LONG, don't have time to finish them:(

Literally the worst professor I have ever had at KSU. Not only does she rush through material unnecessarily fast, but she doesn't go over everything you're going to see in the homework, which by the way is through mymathlab. Instead of helping, she posts youtube videos on D2L and I shouldn't be paying for college for youtube to teach me calculus

While Dr. Hadaway's class is NOT easy, if you work hard at it you can get an A. The random pop quizzes are an annoyance, but if you want a good grade, you have to stay on top of the HW and then the quizzes are easy. At the end of the semester she gave several opportunities for extra credit. Don't expect an easy class, but work for your A.

Dr. Hadaway is a nice individual; however, she is a very poor quality professor. She is not very helpful, rushes over the material unnecessarily fast and was not very willing to help during office hours either. The tests/quizzes were impossible. I would not recommend her to anyone interested in passing calc 1...

This teacher is a really nice person but an awful teacher! I hated her class and her teaching technique is so fast and confusing. Her quizzes are easy but her tests are super hard and not even similar to the quizzes. I love math but this teacher just ruined for me. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS no matter what.

The teacher's personality is wonderful, but her teaching technique is nowhere helpful if you don't have recent prior history to the class. She skips most of the steps while working out examples. It's really hard to follow through her workings. She never provides powerpoint notes nor study guides. NEVER tells you what day the quiz is on :(

Although this professor is very nice, please do not take this class if you have any difficulty with the subject matter. The biggest issue with this professor is that her exams and quizzes are 30 to 50% multiple choice and no partial credit is given, even though she requires you to show all work. Also, no calculator is allowed
